meanings.definition: A thin membrane lining the ventricles of the brain and the central canal of the spinal cord.
meanings.sent1: The ependyma helps protect the brain and spinal cord.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study the ependyma to understand brain health.
meanings.sent3: The ependyma threw a party for the neurons in the brain.
meanings.sent4: Her love for learning was an ependyma, surrounding her mind with knowledge.
meanings.sent5: The ependyma, like a guardian, shields the delicate brain tissue.

meanings.definition: The epithelial cells that make up the ependyma.
meanings.sent1: Scientists are researching the ependyma cells for medical advancements.
meanings.sent2: The ependyma plays a crucial role in brain function.
meanings.sent3: The ependyma cells had a dance-off with the neurons.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to his work was an ependyma, forming the foundation of his success.
meanings.sent5: Under the microscope, the ependyma cells appeared like tiny guardians of the brain.
